name: CodeAnalysis
description: Perform Code Analysis on your Solution/Projects
author: Total ALM

inputs.name: inputFiles
inputs.label: Input Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the target assembly to analyze. If you specify a directory, FxCopCmd tries to analyze all files that have the .exe or .dll extension.

inputs.name: output
inputs.label: Output File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the file name for the analysis report. If the file exists, it is overwritten without warning. If no items are reported by the analysis and the file does not exist, it is not created. If the file exists, it is deleted. By default, the file includes an xml-style sheet processing instruction that references FxCopReport.xsl. The file is saved in XML format unless /applyoutXsl is specified.

inputs.name: addDefaultRuleSets
inputs.label: Add Default Rule Sets
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use only if you wish to add Rule Sets.

inputs.name: removeDefaultRuleSets
inputs.label: Remove Default Rule Sets
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use only if you wish to remove Rule Sets.

inputs.name: applyoutXsl
inputs.label: XSL transformation in Report
inputs.helpMarkDown: Applies the XSL transformation that is specified in /out: to the analysis report before saving the file.

inputs.name: summary
inputs.label: Summary
inputs.helpMarkDown: Includes a summary report that has the informational messages returned by FxCopCmd. The summary shows the number of items found, how many items were new, and the running time for the analysis.

inputs.name: console
inputs.label: Console
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directs analysis output to the console or to the Output window in Visual Studio .NET. By default, the XSL file FxCopConsoleOutput.xsl is applied to the output before it is displayed.

inputs.name: types
inputs.label: Types
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the types to analyze. This option disables analysis of assemblies, namespaces, and resources; only the specified types and their members are included in the analysis. The elements of <type list> can use the wildcard character '*' at the end of the name to select multiple types.

inputs.name: addCustomRuleLibraries
inputs.label: Add Custom Rule Libraries
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the location of rule libraries to load. If you specify a directory, FxCopCmd tries to load all files that have the .dll extension.

inputs.name: addCustomRuleSets
inputs.label: Add Custom Rule Sets
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use only if you wish to add custom Rule Sets.

inputs.name: removeCustomRuleSets
inputs.label: Remove Custom Rule Sets
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use only if you wish to remove Rule Sets.

inputs.name: consoleXsl
inputs.label: XSL transformation in Console
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the XSL or XSLT file that contains a transformation to be applied to the analysis output before it is displayed in the console or the Output window of Visual Studio.
